metadata.title: CVE-2019-19604 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Arbitrary command execution is possible in Git before 2.20.2, 2.21.x before2.21.1, 2.22.x before 2.22.2, 2.23.x before 2.23.1, and 2.24.x before2.24.1 because a "git submodule update" operation can run commands found inthe .gitmodules file of a malicious repository.

criterions.comment: git: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
